author: SuperSonicFan172

text: @***** Why even make this reply?
author: SuperSonicFan172

text: @***** You dont even know the definition of bully. You just insult because you cant come up with a proper response, and stop giving +1 to yourself, thats lame.
author: SuperSonicFan172

text: @SuperSonicFan172  In a world where a comment like yours is considered to be "rude", the bullies are as mean as a gang of Yoshis. There is nothing rude about it. Sometimes it seems that every comment to a YouTube video that is not "I totally love this" or "XYZ people are [semi-funny reference to the subject at hand]" (in reference to people who give thumbs down) is considered bad. As long as people do not cross the line they should not be bullied (...) by the morality police, in this case our good and dear Loveness McFarrin. And to get back on topic: You are absolutely right about the ear bleeding. Most of the soundtrack is great, though. Agh, your comments are five months old, why do I even bother... :)
author: BeleuchteteBrueder

text: @BeleuchteteBrueder Dude, i can still see who replies to my older comments. And yes, McFarrin just couldnt handle my humble opinion because his parents probably made him very sensible. Dont get me wrong, the soundtrack is awesome, but since it was for the ps1, its kinda high pitched.
author: SuperSonicFan172

text: +SuperSonicFan172 True, but so beautiful <3 <3

author: Alexx1083

text:
@Alexx1083 
But it is. :D
When you know your true passion, everyday is beautiful, even more beautiful than this music.
You'll know when you find it. Yasunori Mitsuda did, and he never let go.
Never give up! There's a reason why that's a cliché. :D

text: This song makes me feel like I'm walking through an ancient forest, full of creatures long thought extinct or mythical. Their peaceful expressions, tell me man has not set foot in this sacred ground for eons...
author: ssonic15

text: I actually can't stand this song. I don't know why, either. The rest of CT's soundtrack, is absolute A+. But whenever this song would play when I was a kid playing the game, I would mute the TV. Wish I knew why I didn't like it. :(
author: SkeletonBill

text:
@Lazera Haha. Hey, it's fine. I do that all the time. 

I'm a huge fan of time travel, me being a fan of Doctor Who only proves that. I think, it was this game that got me into the whole theory of traveling through time; especially at such an early age. This game never gets old for me.
author: Song Of Ourselves

text: You know what's funny?  For Best VGM you practically put this entire game's soundtrack on.  Now THAT is a testament to how much musical ass this game kicks.  If your orgasm dies down enough that you can actually get around to playing the game, your head will explode simply because the gameplay is even better!  For those that haven't played Chrono Trigger, yes...yes it is possible for this game to get even better.  Do yourselves a favor and play it!
